answers.answer: I meant to say he weighs 75 lbs. - Not 175!

question: However, I do have "pre diabetes" which I have had for over 10 years, so nothing new here.  My A1C was 5.3.  My numbers ever 1/2 hour were a little lower than what my monitor read.  So, maybe it's my monitor?  I don' t know.  But I"m putting it away for a while and not thinking about it LOL!  So, that's that. So, what I still and only have is "neuropathy in my feet".  I'll keep taking the meds for that - the Gabapentin (neurotonin) .  I've decided that I am still going to go low carb and lose some weight.   I need to go low carb to combat the effects this medication is having on my body - and it ain't good LOL!   Plus, I took my son to the Dr. yesterday, (he will be 6 in march), he is 3'10" tall and weighs 175, which is NOT good.  I need to find out where he is getting all the calories from, cause it sure isn't at home.  I am going to start packing his lunches from now on.  And i am going to make a little workout area for us downstairs.  I'm going to find a video for mom/child to exercise too and we're going to get FIT.  Gotta go, work is getting my way of posting LOL!!
title: Results back - I do not have Diabetes (m)....
